page.title: 13FARMING IN BRAMSHAW AREA
page.content: No dairy herds. Arable land, a little silage & hay made. {INTENSIVE CALF REARING.}Calves are bought, fed substitute nourishment & hay until old enough to move for fat stock. Undercover feeding then on hay, silage, concentrates with periods on grasslands. {INTENSIVE PIG REARING.}Pigs kept under cover with controlled feeding. {FOREST RIGHT OF PASTURE.}Smallholdings use this still. Calves remain with cows on Forest while suckling, returning home morning & evening for feed & checking. Older stock roam free until fit to fatten or slaughter. {FOREST RIGHT OF MAST.}Pigs can feed out during pannage season. Sows only can feed out all year & may be met with their litters.
